text: Thomas Curnow (1855 - early December 1922) was primarily involved in assisting the capture of Ned Kelly, which ended with Kelly being hanged on 11 November 1880, Curnow was a schoolteacher. He had alerted authorities about Ned's movements near Glenrowan, which led to his final stand (see Siege of Glenrowan) Category:1855 births Category:1922 deaths Category:Australian educators
title: Thomas Curnow
